ygData.subject: Re: I can't get Heritrix to run
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I had the same problem.  The heritrix shell script was ignoring the CLASSPATH that was in the environment and resetting it to its own.  Hard-code the CP

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "tipassoi" <tipassoi@y...> wrote:
> 
I had the same problem.  The heritrix shell script was ignoring
the CLASSPATH that was in the environment and resetting it to its
own.  Hard-code the CP variable near the beginning of the heritrix
script.  E.g. CP=${CLASSPATH}, or CP=/path/to/what/you/want.
bergmark_d

> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Michael Stack <stack@a...>
wrote:
> > tipassoi wrote:
> > 
> > >
> > > Thanks for your reply.
> > >
> > > After trying to run heritrix under cygwin, the heritrix_out.log file
> > > says "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
org/archive/crawler/Heritrix". I
> > > definitely have the heritrix jar and the heritrix directory in the
> > > classpath.

> 
> I went into the uni computing service, and looked at the code with the
> guy there. It seems that Heritrix overrides CLASSPATH, and looks for
> things where it thinks they should be rather than where I put in
> CLASSPATH.
